intro: Leptopetalum strigulosum var. parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved leptopetalum, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. It produces clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. This species is often found in moist, acidic soils in forested areas.
